website_summaries.verdict: The NB Minimus Prevail fuses the best of minimalist shoes and CrossFit footwear, without leaning too much towards either one. It’s thin and firm base will make sure the foot stays stable during weightlifting, while the lightweight and breathable construction will accommodate agile exercises.
pros: The trainer is perfect for anything from HIIT training to weightlifting, according to numerous users
Many wearers say that it feels very light on the foot
In fact, it is one of the most lightweight models on the market
The perforated knit upper allows the foot to breathe inside the shoe, as stated by most testers
CrossFit enthusiasts claim that the minimalist sole offers excellent ground contact and power delivery for lifting
The trainer has received multiple compliments for its solid lateral stability
Most people admire the Vibram outsole for its supreme traction on gym floors
cons: More than a few users find the Prevail stiffer and clunkier than the Minimus 40 trainer
An expert reviewer disfavored the tongue as it digs into the skin when the laces are pulled tightly

customer_reviews.title: Great, minimal drop shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. Very comfortable and minimal drop while still having enough padding for all day city walking. I switched to zero or minimal drop shoes about eighteen months ago, and all of my back pain has gone away! I don't think these shoes would work for me as a running shoe, but I wear them all day walking around New York City, and they were the only shoe I brought on a three week trip to Bangkok. I can walk all day in them with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, run narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I wear either 6.5 or 7 in Nike's, and these in 7 are right between those two sizes in length, but more narrow. For me, that adds up to my feet being very secure, but not constrained. But if you even occasionally need to go for wides. They look and feel well put together. The black and dark blue is understated, but not plain. As a minimal style, there's no arch support. The soles are more flexible than standard styles, but not as bendy as the other minimal styles I own. Very low profile and flat. Very happy with the quality versus the price, and for me they're a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: NB Minimus series continues to evolve
customer_reviews.text: This is a substantial Minimus from New Balance. What I mean is that it has the material needed for foot containment/protection but it's minimal in the sense that there is no angle keeping your heel higher than your toes. It also has minimal sole. The result is that you're more connected to the ground when you lift weights or do other exercises. Not cushy at all, so know what you're getting into. But great construction and fit. Excellent workout shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mike.G689

customer_reviews.title: Horribly Flat
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are horrible. There is absolutely no support. I get that these are cross trainers but I can feel and hear the flatness of these shoes so much that it affects the way you walk. I have other minimus shoes and love them. Was very disappointed with these.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great training shoe, but I wouldn't use it as a running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Great training shoe, but I wouldn't use it as a running shoe. Once I broke them in, they're a great training shoe, but running in them isn't ideal. I run a quarter mile to warm up, and that's about as long as I could handle. The base is too flat for a good run, but it's a great stable base for weight training. They do run narrow, so if you have wide-ish feet get the your size in wide. They also look great as a semi casual shoe with a good pair of dark jeans if that's your flavor. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: caveman

customer_reviews.title: I found my new gym shoe
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love this shoe. I have been looking for a new gym shoe. I don’t think I will long distance but it has a nice flat base for everything gym stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely an amazing Shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing literally right out of the box, the are so comfortable and such an attractive looking shoe. Now the catch here is knowing if you need a wide fit or not.. I’m a men’s size 12 but I know from previously owned NB shoes that I need a 12 Wide for total comfort so it would do you well to figure this out before you order your first pair. Other than that, GET THEM! You won’t regret it
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Colvin

customer_reviews.title: My go-to Crossfit Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've been into Crossfit since 2014 and have gone through Nike's, Rebooks, New Balance, and Nobulls. Currently, these are my go-to shoes for WODs. These offer great stability for Olympic lifts and are also serviceable for more explosive, mobility work, during a WOD. I keep putting these shoes on over my Nobulls and continue to have great workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Haden Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great for cross training workouts. Lots of lateral stability. Also good for lifting. Not so great for long distance running, but for 500 meters they are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite shoe for working out. Great support for lifting heavy and comfortable enough for short runs and cardio. Lots of remarks on this particular design being really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Kipp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Training Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love these things, they breath great (I have sweaty feet) and are comfortable enough with a minimal shoe approach.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Conley

customer_reviews.title: Wide is not wide!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these in the wide, they are not wide at all! They are actually pretty narrow. Had to return them. If you are looking for a wide shoe, do not order these!
customer_reviews.author: Martin W.

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Best cross-training shoe experience since the original NB MX20GL4s I started buying a few years back. The shape is near-perfect for my foot (wide up front, narrow in back), and the shoe accommodates my orthotics perfectly. Bravo NB!
customer_reviews.author: Rob OnRecord

customer_reviews.title: Stitching not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Just inboxed, tried on shoe and as I pulled on the tongue the stitching tore. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are slick, low profile and have just enough room for my width. I have half a dozen other pair of NBs, and the width on these are a bit tighter than the others, but it feels like they're hugging my feet in a good way.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan D. Quevedo

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for working out - cross training.
customer_reviews.text: Great for in the gym. Light and the sole is tacky to hold your positions while training. Good for indoor runs. Laces are too long for my preference but that's easily changed.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Kicks keep getting harder to find
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking kicks, for my big ass feet like a glove
customer_reviews.author: Robert Chancholo

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: It is incredibly difficult to find athletic shoes in my size (10.5 EEE). I took the leap on the New Balance Minimus Cross Trainer and found it is just a great shoe for exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Grado

customer_reviews.title: Good cross-training shoe.
customer_reviews.text: - Comfortable, sole is flexible , and upper is breathable. - no long distance running
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for functional and cross-training
customer_reviews.text: Good quality materials and assembly. Sturdy shoe but not heavy. Great lateral stability and grip without inhibiting forward movement. Ideal for functional training and cross training.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wear these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these sneakers. I have been wearing Minimus for years and this model is one of the best Great delivery and great product
customer_reviews.author: Arnold S

customer_reviews.title: Manufacture Error
customer_reviews.text: Left shoe is missing top eyelets for laces so I cannot tighten shoe all the way up. Seems like a great pair of shoes. Surprised at this manufacture error.
customer_reviews.author: Theo Longenecker

customer_reviews.title: I really like the shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very comfortable and the fit for me was just right as far as the width.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoe too big
customer_reviews.text: I bought NB shoes before in the same size and fit perfect. These are way too BIG.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R. Borecki

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable, high-quality cross-trainer for a very reasonable price. These will last me a good while!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: theyre great
customer_reviews.text: Great Color ways Awesome comfort They look and feel great
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Ruminski

customer_reviews.title: The color of the shoe was wrong
customer_reviews.text: Got the wright sneaker order. But wrong color. The shoes were sapost to be black. Not dark gray.
customer_reviews.author: Sean mccafferty

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes, will absolutely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Easily the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn. Fits perfect
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Bukowski

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I bought them to use for squats. I normally squat barefooted but uptight people look at me cray cray when I do, so I found these shoes. I love them! So much so that I wear them to work.
customer_reviews.author: Flex this

customer_reviews.title: Much too narrow in the toe box
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, this shoe is much narrower in the toe box than past NB offerings. Steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: daniel porter

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Minimus Prevail V1 Cross Trainer
product_meta.description: The Minimus Prevail cross training shoe for men is designed to help bring strength, style and stability to your workout. Its engineered knit upper is infused with TPU fibers that help offer support as you lift weights and train with underfoot support and a good ground feel.
feature_bullets: Knit upper infused with TPU fibers
